page.title: 08RADSTOCK REMEMBERS.
page.content: 1985 saw the 300th anniversary of the Monmouth Rebellion. Schools throughout the west renacted the march. Some children from our school marched from Norton St Philip to Frome dressed in period costume. All the school did work on it. One class made several visits to Norton St Philip to do work about the skirmish (battle) there. Mr Bates the Headmaster told us about it and showed slides to us in assembly. The 1st year classes were studying housing and families in stuart times. Two classes were doing about the march plus the transport in the period. Another class did the story of the battle for the throne. We enjoyed this project about Monmouth because it was so local. The 9 mile march was brilliant (and tiring!)
